newsitem.title: CHINA: CASIL Telecom says to invest HK$148 mln in R&D.
newsitem.headline: CASIL Telecom says to invest HK$148 mln in R&D.

text.p: CASIL Telecommunications Holdings Ltd, a unit of China Aerospace International Holdings Ltd, said on Monday it would use the HK$148 million in proceeds from its flotation to develop telecoms products.
"The company has its own sources of financing for its future business development and that will speed up its growth in future," CASIL Telecom's chairman Wang Mei Yue told a press briefing on Monday.
CASIL Telecom said HK$60 million of the funds would be used for research and development of ATM switching system products, a technology for transferring digital signals to be used on networks.

It also said HK$25 million would be used to develop central switching systems, HK$20 million for development of global positioning systems (GPS) products, and HK$15 million for development of local loop carriers (LLC) products.
The balance of the proceed will be used as working capital.

CASIL Telecom said earlier it would issue 150 million shares at HK$1.18 per share in an initial public offering (IPO) in Hong Kong. The IPO will run from July 29 to August 1, shares will begin trading on August 11.

Of the issue, up to 30 million new shares will be offered on a preferential basis to China Aerospace's existing shareholders at a ratio of one CASIL Telecom share for every 25 China Aerospace shares held.

Some 7.5 million CASIL Telecom shares will be offered to the company's employees, and 'strategic investors' have agreed to take a total 83.94 million shares, or 13.99 percent of the company's enlarged share capital, at the issue price.
These strategic investors are CIS International Holdings Ltd, an affiliate of CIS Technology, and the Dimerco group of companies, a Taiwan-based construction and property development group.
CASIL Telecom said the two companies had undertaken to hold their stakes for at least six months after the listing. The remaining shares will be offered to the public in Hong Kong.

The company said proceeds from the CIS International and Dimerco tranches would be used by the wholly-owned Taiwan CASTEL Holdings Ltd for development and manufacture of telecoms technology and equipment in Taiwan.
CASIL Telecom is engaged in design and manufacture telecommunications and GPS businesses. Its market covers China, Hong Kong, Southeast Asia , America and Europe.

It posted a profit of HK$47.27 million in 1996, up from HK$22.55 million in 1995 and HK$15.04 million in 1994. Turnover was HK$273.34 million in 1996, up from HK$206.78 million in 1995 and HK$202.05 million in 1994.
